ARABIC: وَإِنِّى لَغَفَّارٌ لِّمَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحًا ثُمَّ ٱهْتَدَىٰ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But I am Ever-Forgiving to anyone who makes tawba and has iman and acts rightly and then is guided.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet I am gracious to him who repents and believes, and does the right, and follows the straight path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But I am indeed Most Forgiving to him who repents and believes and does righteous works and keeps to the Right Way."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I allowed you to consume the pure sustenance which We had given you but not to become rebels, lest you become subject to My wrath. Whoever becomes subject to My wrath will certainly be destroyed. I am All-forgiving to the righteously striving believers who repent and follow the right guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed I am Most Oft Forgiving for him who repented and accepted faith and did good deeds, and then remained upon guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And verily, I am indeed forgiving to him who repents, believes and does righteous deeds, and then Ihtada.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And most surely I am most Forgiving to him who repents and believes and does good, then continues to follow the right direction.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Yet I am All-forgiving to him who repents and believes, and does righteousness, and at last is guided.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And lo! verily I am Forgiving toward him who repenteth and believeth and doeth good, and afterward walketh aright.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But I am most forgiving towards him who turns in repentance and believes and acts righteously and follows the right path."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And verily I am the Most Forgiving unto whomsoever repenteth and believeth and worketh righteously, and thereafter letteth himself remain guided.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed I forgive those who repent, become faithful, act righteously, and follow guidance.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But, without doubt, I am (also) He that forgives again and again, to those who repent, believe, and do right, who,- in fine, are ready to receive true guidance."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And verily, I am indeed Forgiving to him who repents, believes (in My Oneness, and associates none in worship with Me) and does righteous good deeds, and then remains constant in doing them, (till his death).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: but to whosoever repents, believes and does good deeds, and is at last guided, I am Forgiving'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And I am Forgiving towards him who repents, believes, acts righteously, and then remains guided.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:82] And indeed I am Forgiving toward him who repents, from ascribing partners [to God], and believes, affirms God’s Oneness, and acts righteously, is sincere in [performing] the obligatory and the supererogatory [deeds], and then follows guidance’, by adhering to what has been mentioned up to his death.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And lo! verily I am Forgiving towards him who repenteth) from idolatry (and believeth) in Allah (and doeth good) with sincerity, (and afterward walketh aright) then truly sees the reward of his works; it is also said that this means: he is guided to the community of the orthodox faithful (ahl al-sunnah wa'l-jama'ah) and dies in that state.
